org.openimaj.audio.samples

Class SampleBuffer16Bit

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.audio.samples.SampleBuffer16Bit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Float>, Iterator<Float>, SampleBuffer

    public class SampleBuffer16Bit
extends Object
implements SampleBuffer, Iterator<Float>
    A SampleBuffer for 16-bit sample chunks.
    Author:
    David Dupplaw (dpd@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SampleBuffer16Bit(AudioFormat af, int nSamples)
      Create a new 16-bit sample buffer using the given sample format at the given size.
      SampleBuffer16Bit(SampleChunk samples, AudioFormat af)
      Create a new 16-bit sample buffer using the given samples and the given audio format.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SampleBuffer16Bit

        public SampleBuffer16Bit(SampleChunk samples,
                 AudioFormat af)
        Create a new 16-bit sample buffer using the given samples and the given audio format.
        Parameters:
        samples - The samples to buffer.
        af - The audio format.

      • SampleBuffer16Bit

        public SampleBuffer16Bit(AudioFormat af,
                 int nSamples)
        Create a new 16-bit sample buffer using the given sample format at the given size. It does not scale for the number of channels in the audio format, so you must pre-multiply the number of samples by the number of channels if you are only counting samples per channel.
        Parameters:
        af - The audio format of the samples
        nSamples - The number of samples

    • Method Detail

      • getSampleChunk

        public SampleChunk getSampleChunk()
        Return a sample chunk that contains the data from this sample buffer. Note that any timestamps will be unset in the new sample chunk.
        Specified by:
        getSampleChunk in interface SampleBuffer
        Returns:
        A SampleChunk containing data in this buffer.
        See Also:
        SampleBuffer.getSampleChunk()

      • getSampleChunk

        public SampleChunk getSampleChunk(int channel)
        Return a sample chunk that contains the data from a specific channel in this sample buffer. The channel is numbered from 0 (so mono audio streams will only have 1 channel accessed with getSampleChunk(0)). Note that any timestamps will be unset in the new sample chunk. Note that because we cannot use native methods for copying parts of an array, we must use Java methods so this will be considerably slower than getSampleChunk().
        Specified by:
        getSampleChunk in interface SampleBuffer
        Parameters:
        channel - The channel
        Returns:
        A SampleChunk containing data in this buffer.
        See Also:
        SampleBuffer.getSampleChunk(int)

      • get

        public float get(int index)
        Get the sample at the given index. The sample will be a float and have a value between Integer.MAX_VALUE and Integer.MIN_VALUE. That sample will be signed.
        Specified by:
        get in interface SampleBuffer
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the sample to retrieve
        Returns:
        The sample value as an float
        See Also:
        SampleBuffer.get(int)

      • getUnscaled

        public float getUnscaled(int index)
        Returns the sample value at the given index without scaling - that is, at it's original sample value. This can be useful for debugging, or if the sample buffer is being used for non-audio applications.
        Specified by:
        getUnscaled in interface SampleBuffer
        Parameters:
        index - The index to retrieve
        Returns:
        The value unscaled
        See Also:
        SampleBuffer.getUnscaled(int)

      • set

        public void set(int index,
       float sample)
        Set the sample value at the given index. The sample value should be scaled between Integer.MAX_VALUE and Integer.MIN_VALUE (i.e. it should be signed).
        Specified by:
        set in interface SampleBuffer
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the sample to set.
        sample - The sample value to set.
        See Also:
        SampleBuffer.set(int, float)

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the size of this buffer. Divide by the number of channels to get the number of samples per channel.
        Specified by:
        size in interface SampleBuffer
        Returns:
        the size of this buffer.
        See Also:
        SampleBuffer.size()

      • getStartTimecode

        public AudioTimecode getStartTimecode()
        Description copied from interface: SampleBuffer
        Returns the timecode of the start of this sample buffer. May return null if the timecode is unknown or has no meaning in this context.
        Specified by:
        getStartTimecode in interface SampleBuffer
        Returns:
